1.question: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling can only scale out (increase instances) when the load increases but cannot scale in (decrease instances).

options.A: On multiple volumes within an availability zone.
options.C: In multiple Availability zones within the same region.
options.D: Across multiple regions for higher durability.

9.question: AWS Trusted Advisor provides insight regarding which five categories of an AWS account?

options.A: Performance, cost optimization, access control, connectivity, security
options.B: Performance, cost optimization, security, fault tolerance, service limits.
options.C: Security, Fault tolerance, high availability, connectivity, service limits
options.D: Security, access control, high availability, performance, service limits

options.B: Query across multiple tables at once using sort key filter

18.question: If your project requires monthly reports that iterate through very large amounts of data, which Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud EC2 purchasing option should you consider?

19.question: In a VPC, you have set up a public-facing web application. You want to ensure the application is resilient to failures in a single Availability Zone. Which of the following actions should you take to improve fault tolerance?

options.A: Place all application servers in a single public subnet within one Availability Zone.
options.B: Increase the size of your EC2 instances in one Availability Zone to handle more traffic.
options.C: Create an Auto Scaling group that spans multiple Availability Zones and deploy instances in multiple public subnets.
options.D: Use only one Availability Zone with increased instance count in a single subnet.
